Transcript: Livvie: Jack? Jack, are you there?
Jack: Livvie. Oh, it is good to hear your voice.
Livvie: Oh, thank God. Please, Jack, tell me you're ok.
Jack: I'm fine, sweetie, all right? Is Jamal on the way?
Livvie: Yeah. He just left. Jack, be careful, ok?
Jack: I got to go, all right? Zach's catching me.
Livvie: They're chasing him. He needs help.
Alison: Jamal? Jack is in trouble. Have you found him yet?
Jamal: No, not yet.
Jamal: There they are. Hold on, Jack. I'm coming, bro.
[Motorcycle engines]
Jamal: Hey, Livvie, tell Jack to watch his back.
Livvie: Jack, Jamal says watch your back. Jack, can you hear me?
Alison: Is he not answering?
Livvie: I don't know. He keeps coming in and out. Jack, are you there?
Jamal: Jack!
Livvie: Jack!
Jack: Livvie!
Michael: After all that I've done to keep you safe, why? Why did you do it?
Ian: You mean --

Eve: I'm pregnant. And that's why I ran away. I couldn't tell you before 
because Arianna was so sick and everything that you were going through, you had 
so much on your plate. I just didn't want to add anything more for you to think 
about. But now you're here and it's true. We're going to have a baby, Thornhart. 
You and me. We're going to have a baby. Gosh, are you going to say anything?
Livvie: Something happened. I have to get to Jack.
Alison: Wait, Livvie. What happened?

Livvie: I don't know. Alison, I heard a crash, and then his headset just went 
dead.
Alison: Ok, well, then we'll just try and get Jamal, ok?
Livvie: No, you try. I have to get out there. Jack could be hurt.

Alison: Livvie, no! I'm sure he's fine, ok? It was probably just static or 
something.
Livvie: Well, you can stand around and wait to find out, but I'm not.
Alison: Livvie, Jamal told us to stay here. It was dangerous, he said.
Livvie: I don't care!

Alison: Look, this guy just pulled a gun on all of us. They are not playing 
around!
Livvie: No! I don't care! Jack needs me. I just know it.
Alison: Wait! I'm coming with you.
Jamal: Jack!
Sam: He's dead. Jack's dead.
Zach: It was an accident.
Jamal: Like hell it was, man. You were trying to kill him.
Man: Easy, man!
Jamal: You're going to pay for this. You're going to pay, so help me.
Zach: Jamal, you're going to pay.
Jamal: What are you talking about?
Zach: Where were you, Woods, huh? Weren't you the one supposed to ride?
Jamal: Well, I don't ride, so you kill a guy?

Zach: We all know you bagged it on purpose so your friend there'd have to 
fill in.
Jamal: Are you crazy?
Zach: Your friend you threatened to off because he hit on your girl.
Jamal: You're full of it.

Zach: And you got a record, man, so who they going to believe? You get what 
I'm saying? If anybody's going to take the rap here, it's you.
Sam: Come on. We got to get out of here. The cops are going to come.
Zach: This is on your head, Woods, yours and nobody else's.
[Engines rev]
Jamal: Jack. He's moving. He's alive.

Michael: Answer me, Caleb. Why do you keep trying to run away when you know 
it could be dangerous for you, when you know what I'm doing is for your own 
good?
[Caleb laughs]
Caleb: Just stick to saving the world, St. Michael. Leave me out of it.
Michael: I can't. You're my brother.
Caleb: Aw, isn't that touching?
Michael: Where'd you go this time? What did you do? What did you do?
Caleb: Let's just say I got my eye on a certain sweet young thing.

Michael: You're talking about Eve. She left. She's gone. And I wouldn't have 
let you hurt her, anyway. You're never going to hurt anyone ever again.

Caleb: Come on. Who are you kidding? You can't keep me prisoner here forever. 
You know I always find a way out.
Ian: I don't believe it.
Eve: Trust me, I wouldn't lie about something like this.
Ian: You're having a baby?
Eve: Our baby.
Ian: My God, Eve -- Eve, I'm --
Eve: Well, are you -- are you happy about this?
Ian: "Happy?" You have made me the happiest man in the world.
Eve: Oh, thank God. Thank God. I wasn't sure how you'd feel.
Ian: You should have told me straight away. You should have --
Eve: I wanted to, I wanted to, but Arianna --
Ian: Arianna's fine. She's going to be great.
Eve: What?
Ian: Yeah. Karen came through as a liver donor.
Eve: She had the transplant?
Ian: Yes. And it was a near-perfect match. Couldn't have gone any better.

Eve: Oh, my God. That's incredible. Oh, that's incredible. But what about -- 
I mean, does she know where you are?
Ian: Yes, yeah -- no, she told me to come find you.
Eve: She did?

Ian: Yeah. She wants to start a new life, her own life, for the first time. 
And as soon as she gets on her feet, we're going to set her up -- new job in a 
safe town, safe place, beautiful place. She's going to love it.
Eve: Oh, my God. So Arianna's really going to be ok. She's going to be ok.

Ian: Yeah. This is something, isn't it? This -- this is something. Divine 
intervention -- me finding you here.

Eve: You know, I had a feeling about this place from the moment I stepped 
inside. You know, from the moment I met Michael, I --
Ian: Michael?
Eve: He's the priest who's restoring this place.
Ian: Oh, right. No, no, I met him.
Eve: Yeah.
Ian: And how did you guys --

Eve: I went for a walk this one day, and I was really confused. I just -- I 
needed -- he helped me.
Ian: Tell me, please. Tell me you're not confused anymore.
Eve: How could I be? You came for me. You're here.

Ian: That's right, I'm here. I found you. And I'm never going to lose you 
ever again. I'm never going to let you go.
Ian: Think of it, Lambert. We're having a baby.
Eve: Yeah, well, that's pretty much all I have been able to think about.
Ian: And you're ok? Everything's fine and --
Eve: Well, I'm a little bit tired, but other than that, you know --
Ian: Then rest.
Eve: No, I'm fine!
Ian: No, sit.

Eve: Look, Thornhart, listen. We've got a ways to go with this, so you should 
save the pampering, you know.
Ian: Listen to the good doctor and sit down.
Eve: Ok.
Ian: Ok. Ok.
Eve: So, you haven't told me -- how did you find me?
Ian: Well, no, I just followed my heart.
Eve: Yeah, but, I mean -- to some falling down old monastery?
Ian: No, no, I -- I went to the cabin.
Eve: Our cabin. You know me so well.
Ian: But you weren't there.
Eve: Well, you must have just missed me.
Ian: I thought I'd lost you forever. I was heading back to Port Charles.
Eve: But you didn't go.
Ian: No.
Eve: Why not?

Ian: Because I heard a voice, a very determined voice. It told me not to give 
up, and I'm glad I listened.
Eve: Well, that doesn't explain why you're here.

Ian: No, I know, but I -- I -- I started walking, and I kept walking because 
I knew if I did, I would find you.
Eve: Just like that?
Ian: Yeah, just like that.
Eve: Wow.
Ian: Did you ever doubt that I'd come for you?

Eve: Oh, I prayed every day that you would. But with everything that was 
going on with Arianna, I just -- you know, I had to try and stop thinking about 
you and put you out of my mind altogether.
Ian: I'm sorry I put us through this.
Eve: No, no, no, no. I shouldn't have left.

Ian: But that's all behind us now because we're -- we're together -- and 
we're -- we're having a baby.
Eve: And Arianna's ok.
Ian: And I love you.
Eve: Oh --
Ian: Did I tell you how much I love you?

Eve: You know, if you didn't, I would have you say it again and again and 
again.
Ian: I love you more than life itself.
Eve: I love you so much.
Eve: Hmm, hmm, wait, wait, wait, wait.
Ian: Huh?
Eve: I just thought about where we are.
Ian: Right.
Eve: Yeah.
Ian: We can't.
Eve: No.
Ian: Sorry. I have an idea.
Eve: Cabin?
Ian: Yeah. How soon can we be on our way?
Eve: Right now.
Ian: Let's go.

Eve: Ok, wait. But -- but I have to find Michael. I have to tell him our good 
news!
Ian: No, we'll send him a postcard.

Eve: No. No, really. I mean, he has been so helpful to me. I really want to 
tell him in person. I'm sure he's here somewhere.
Ian: Ok. You rest. I'll go find him.
Eve: But I want to go with you.

Ian: No, you're going to stay right here. Otherwise, we're going to keep 
going with this, and you know what that's going to lead to.
Eve: Right, right, right, ok. Go. Ok, you go and get Michael.
Ian: Ok. Ok.
Livvie: Jack!
Alison: Jamal!
Jamal: Down here!
Livvie: Jack!

Jamal: All right, just -- just hang in there, buddy. All right? Everything's

Jack: Livvie -- Livvie --

Jamal: All right, yeah, Livvie's ok. She's ok. She's coming right now. All

Jack: Zach -- Zach was smuggling diamonds.

Livvie: Jack -- Jack, I'm here. Honey --
Alison: Jamal, we need to get him to the hospital.
Jamal: No, no, no, we can't move him. Just call 911 on your cell phone, Ali.
Alison: I left it back at the tent.

Jamal: All right. All right, Livvie, you and Alison go. You guys go get help,

Livvie: No. No, no. I'm not leaving him.
Alison: That's ok. We'll go. Come on. Come on.
Jamal: Ok, we'll be right back.
Livvie: You guys, hurry, please. Hurry!
Jack: Livvie --
Livvie: Hey, don't try and talk. Save your strength, ok?
Jack: There's so much I wanted to tell you.
Livvie: Shh. I know. I know.
Jack: So much I wanted to do with you.
Livvie: And you still will. Ok? Everything we talked about.
Jack: Promise me. Promise me you won't be sad.

Livvie: Jack, don't talk like that. Don't talk like that. You are going to be

Jack: Touch me. Touch me, please. I love you so much.
Livvie: Don't. Don't do this. Don't you dare die on me, Jack. No.
Alison: Jamal, hurry.

Jamal: Maybe -- maybe this isn't such a good idea. Maybe you should just stay 
with Livvie.
Alison: Well, what about Zach?
Jamal: Zach, he's long gone, ok? Just -- I'll be right back, all right?
Livvie: No!
Alison: Oh, my God.
Ian: Father! Hey, I was looking for you.
Michael: Is something wrong? I thought you had left.
Ian: No, everything's fine. What I was looking for is right here.
Michael: I don't understand.
Ian: Eve -- she was here the whole time.
Michael: Eve? I'm sorry. If I had known --

Ian: No. No, no, no. It's fine. We found each other, and we're going to be 
together. We're going to raise a child.
Michael: You must be --
Ian: Ian.
Michael: Ian. Congratulations. Eve must be very happy.
Ian: Oh, thank you, Father. We both are.
Michael: I've heard a lot about you.
Ian: I've heard a lot about you. Thanks for befriending her.

Michael: I can't take any credit. I'm very fond of Eve. All I tried to do was 
ease her pain. It was clearly divine providence that you two found each other.
Ian: Maybe so, but she wants to thank you before we leave for the cabin.
Michael: For the cabin? You're going to the cabin?
Ian: Yeah, for a little while.

Michael: Do you not think it might be better if you started for home as soon 
as possible?
Ian: Why?

Michael: It's just in these mountain roads, it can get dangerous at night. It 
might be best to get an early start.

Ian: Truth be told, we're not leaving tonight, Father, so there's nothing to 
worry about.
Michael: I guess not.
Ian: All right. Let's go see about Eve.

Michael: I'm sorry. Would you -- would you pass along my good wishes to her? 
There is something I need to take care of.
Ian: It's only going to take a minute.
Michael: I'm sorry. It's an urgent matter. If you'll excuse me.
Ian: Ok. I understand.

Michael: But, please, do tell Eve how happy I am that everything worked out 
for her.
Ian: I will. Thank you.
[Footsteps]
Eve: Ian? Ian? Michael? Anyone?
Eve: Oh. Ok. I know I shouldn't, but I really want to.
[Door creaks open]

Ian: Eve? Eve, the doors are locked or jammed or something. Are you in there? 
Eve?
Eve: Hello? Is anyone there?
Jamal: What --
Livvie: He promised he'd never leave me. He promised me.
Jamal: He's gone, Livvie.
Livvie: No.
Jamal: I'm sorry, Livvie.
Livvie: No. No. No. He can't be. He can't be. He can't be.
